paper_metadata.title: Pro-poor tourism: Is there value beyond the rhetoric?

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: This chapter explores the relationship between tourism and poverty reduction, examining particularly the way the term 'pro-poor tourism' (PPT) is being used, and promises made under the guise of PPT.
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: This research probe into pro-poor tourism has raised some serious concerns about the legitimacy of claims that tourism is a good strategy for alleviating poverty.

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: The concept of Pro-Poor Tourism (PPT), which was first used in a British report in 1999
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: better lives for impoverished people struggling to survive at the margins of society
